In AIE, psychiatric manifestations are common early in the course. These may include psychosis, aggression, inappropriate sexual behaviors, panic attacks, compulsive behaviors, mutism, memory loss, euphoria, or fear. Symptoms may fluctuate rapidly. In addition, seizures, cognitive decline, coma, and abnormal movements are common
43, 44 . Clinical differentiation of HSE and AIE may be difficult as psychiatric manifestations and extrapyramidal movements may be seen in both. MRI, polymerase chain reaction (PCR), and antibody detection in CSF/serum may be needed.
